author: gumb00
content:
It's desired by compilers to implement tail call optimizations.
Solidity's stance was - to properly evaluate whether it's really needed they would need to implement entire spec and then see if it can be dropped.

author: draganrakita
content: Makes sense, thanks for answering, imo I wouldn't include JUMPF if we don't have that analysis, it can be always added in fork after.
